topics.body: Hey guys, I'm currently working on some fanfic stuff not MLP. Just a small problem though, I have no idea how the US Marine Corps works, does anyone have any sources for learning how military command structures works? I get confused between who's supposed to out rank someone, I can't tell if the Petty Officer Chief is supposed to match ranks with a Sargent Major and so forth, its kinda confusing for me.

One more thing.
Kiva has a weird gimmick in that it tells two stories during it's run. One about Kurenai Wataru and another that takes place 20 years earlier about his father Kurenai Otoya. So be ready for some weird story elements.

topics.body:
Hey I just remember something funny from some old pony related stuff, one was that gif with Rarity as Lenin. 

So out of the mane six, who's political alignment can you identify?
I mean we've got Twilight who strictly believes in the current monarchy.
AJ and Rarity are likely Capitalists.
Rainbow Dash seems, actually I have no idea where to put her, she seems more like a pro-militarist or something like a nationalist.
Fluttershy seems to be the only Socialist I can remotely relate to.
And Pinkie Pie seems to be her own ideal altogether, which involves parties. That or she's borderline police stat-ism.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

[bq="Evident Disaster"]Hey guys, I'm currently working on some fanfic stuff not MLP. Just a small problem though, I have no idea how the US Marine Corps works, does anyone have any sources for learning how military command structures works? I get confused between who's supposed to out rank someone, I can't tell if the Petty Officer Chief is supposed to match ranks with a Sargent Major and so forth, its kinda confusing for me. [/bq]

"Here":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CommonMilitaryUnits "are":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CommonRanks "some":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NavalGazing "notes":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HistoryOfNavalWarfare that might help a little
